summary: This is a service request record from Convergint Federal Solutions/SigNet Technologies regarding a RAID failure and data corruption incident at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York on August 8, 2019. The document details technical support efforts to replace failed drives in a NICE Vision Pro Unit NVR, which resulted in the corruption of the video database, likely wiping all data.

events.title: RAID Failure Reported at MCC New York
events.description: A service request is created after a RAID array at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York shows 2 failed drives on a NICE Vision Pro Unit NVR.

events.title: Drive Replacement Attempt Leads to Data Corruption
events.description: Hughwon gains access to the DVR room and attempts to replace the failed RAID drives. During the rebuild, drives are removed without proper shutdown, corrupting the video database and likely wiping all data.

locations: 12300 Kiln Ct Suite E, Beltsville, MD 20705
keyFacts: A RAID failure occurred at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York on August 8, 2019, affecting a NICE Vision Pro Unit NVR used for video recording.
The attempted repair on August 10, 2019, by replacing drives without proper shutdown corrupted the video database, likely resulting in the loss of all recorded data.
The service request was handled by Convergint Federal Solutions/SigNet Technologies, indicating potential third-party management of surveillance systems at the MCC.
The incident timeline suggests potential gaps in surveillance recording capability at the MCC during a critical period in August 2019.
Technical guidance was provided by Derek Barr, a senior support engineer, outlining RAID rebuild procedures that require a password ('1111').
